body_html:
OK. From the bash script you can just do set -u first thing.
…
On Wed, Apr 12, 2017 at 11:16 AM, Andrew Selle ***@***.***> wrote: It seems I can do #!/bin/bash -u but I don't think I can use env (which gives robustness to bash not installed in /bin) #!/usr/bin/env bash -u doesn't work because the -u doesn't get sent to bash. — You are receiving this because you commented. body_text:
OK. From the bash script you can just do set -u first thing.
…
On Wed, Apr 12, 2017 at 11:16 AM, Andrew Selle ***@***.***> wrote:
 It seems I can do

 #!/bin/bash -u

 but I don't think I can use env (which gives robustness to bash not
 installed in /bin)

 #!/usr/bin/env bash -u

 doesn't work because the -u doesn't get sent to bash.

 —
 You are receiving this because you commented.
 Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub
 <#9140 (comment)>,
 or mute the thread
 <https://github.com/notifications/unsubscribe-auth/AT_Sbb8gY_x9aoc6O8a1ZDWnlTCWvtqvks5rvRTtgaJpZM4M6fDc>
 .
body:
OK. From the bash script you can just do set -u first thing.

On Wed, Apr 12, 2017 at 11:16 AM, Andrew Selle <notifications@github.com>
wrote:

> It seems I can do
>
> #!/bin/bash -u
>
> but I don't think I can use env (which gives robustness to bash not
> installed in /bin)
>
> #!/usr/bin/env bash -u
>
> doesn't work because the -u doesn't get sent to bash.
>
> —
> You are receiving this because you commented.
> Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub
> <https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/pull/9140#issuecomment-293663003>,
